sentences: Nüüd õpib see inimene hingpuhult, ilma et vaataks head- või kurakätt..
Vaataks kõigepealt üle oma tööd enne lahkumist.
Kui ta oleks vaadanud tähelepanelikemalt, oleks ta näinud viga.
context: The word 'vaataks' is the conditional mood of the Estonian verb 'vaatama', which means 'to look', 'to watch', or 'to observe'. It expresses what someone would do under certain conditions. The '-ks' ending indicates this conditional form, similar to English constructions with 'would'. In the example sentence provided in the dictionary definition, it's used to express that a person would not even look at good or bad hands (in card games) while studying intently.
